entities.description: Codes of 85, 94, 97, and 98 are used to indicate various types of missing data in the survey.
Methods such as predictive mean neighborhood (PMN) and modified predictive mean neighborhood (modPMN) used to impute missing values.
Indicator variables identified with 'IMPUTATION INDICATOR' or the prefix 'IMP IND' that denote imputed values.
Variables with imputed values marked with the prefix 'IR' or 'II' in their labels.
The program used in the survey that might skip certain questions based on the respondent's previous answers.

relationships.description: Indicates the specific codes (85, 94, 97, 98) used to denote missing data in the survey.
Describes the method used for imputing missing values in the survey data.
Indicator variables showing which values in the dataset were imputed.
Revised variables with imputed values, identified with the prefix 'IR' or 'II'.
The CAI program manages which questions are presented or skipped based on respondent's input.
